panels.description: Shows if Graylog service is ready
panels.title: Graylog Status

panels.description: Show Graylog input messages per second
panels.title: Input

panels.description: Show Graylog output messages per second (writed to OenSearch/ElasticSearch)
panels.title: Output

panels.description: How many messages are stored in the Graylog input buffer
panels.title: Input buffer usage

panels.description: How many messages are stored in the Graylog process buffer
panels.title: Process buffer usage

panels.description: How many messages are stored in the Graylog output buffer
panels.title: Output buffer usage

panels.description:
Show Graylog journal utilization. Graylog use journal as temporally storage of received messages which have not yet been processed by ElastiSearch.
High journal utilization shows that ElasticSearch cannot process the input stream fast enough.
panels.title: Journal append rate

panels.description:
Show Graylog journal utilization. Graylog use journal as temporally storage of received messages which have not yet been processed by ElastiSearch.
High journal utilization shows that ElasticSearch cannot process the input stream fast enough.
panels.title: Journal utilization

panels.description: Shows the heap JVM memory  used volume

targets.expr: jvm_memory_bytes_used{cluster="$cluster", instance="$host", area="heap"} / jvm_memory_bytes_max{cluster="$cluster", instance="$host", area="heap"}

panels.title: JVM Heap

panels.description: Show total errors messages (for all log levels)  which occurs in Graylog itself.
panels.title: Error rate, 5m

panels.description: Show Graylog throughput. How much does Graylog process messages from Fluentd to OpenSearh/ElasticSearch.
panels.title: Input / Output throughput

panels.description:
Show the difference between input and output message count.
* `Green` values mean Graylog processes and reduces the messages in buffers.
* `Red` values mean Graylog adds messages in buffers.
panels.title: Throughput correlation

panels.description:
Show Graylog journal utilization. Graylog uses the journal as temporally storage of received messages that have not yet been processed by ElastiSearch.
High journal utilization shows that OpenSeach/ElasticSearch cannot process the input stream fast enough.
panels.title: Journald utilization, %

panels.description: Number of empty messages received by Graylog inputs.
panels.title: Empty messages

panels.description: Number of open connections to Graylog inputs.
panels.title: Open conections

panels.description: Rate of raw data size received by Graylog inputs per second over the last 2 minutes.
panels.title: Raw size, rate 30s

panels.description: Number of bytes read per second by Graylog inputs.
panels.title: Read bytes, sec

panels.description: Rate of incoming traffic to Graylog inputs over the last 2 minutes.
panels.title: Input traffic

panels.description: Number of active executor threads handling Graylog input processing.
panels.title: Executor threads

panels.description: Pipeline cache hit rate
panels.title: Pipeline cache hit rate

panels.description: Cache hit rate for the Graylog pipeline interpreter, indicating how often cached results are used.
panels.title: Pipeline cache hit rate

panels.description: Execution time of the Graylog pipeline interpreter, measuring processing duration per request.
panels.title: Pipeline execution time

panels.description: Time taken to decode messages in the Graylog process buffer.
panels.title: Decode time

panels.description: Time taken to parse messages in the Graylog process buffer.
panels.title: Parse time

panels.description: Rate of messages filtered out by the Graylog process buffer over the last 2 minutes.
panels.title: Filtered messages, count

panels.description: Rate of messages successfully processed and sent from the Graylog process buffer over the last 2 minutes.
panels.title: Outgoing messages, count

panels.description: Number of threads created by the Graylog process buffer thread factory for message processing.
panels.title: Process threads, count

panels.description: Buffer sizes, by type
panels.title: Buffer sizes, by type

panels.description: Represents the current utilization percentage of the Graylog message processing buffer.
panels.title: Buffer usage, by type

panels.description: Represents the time taken to process messages in the Graylog buffer at a specific quantile.
panels.title: Buffer process time, by type

panels.description: Represents the rate of incoming messages processed by the Graylog buffer over the last 2 minutes.
panels.title: Buffer process incoming messages, by type

panels.description: Represents the rate of incoming messages handled by the raw message encoder in Graylog over the last 2 minutes.
panels.title: Buffer raw message encoder handler incoming messages, by type

panels.description: Represents the rate of incoming messages processed by Graylog streams over the last 2 minutes.
panels.title: Incoming messages, per stream

panels.description: Measures the execution time of Graylog stream rules at different quantiles, helping to analyze rule processing performance.

targets.legendFormat: Stream: {{ stream }}, Rule: {{ stream_rule }}, Quantile: {{ quantile }}

panels.title: Stream rules execution time

panels.description: Indicates the number of attempts to remove the default stream in Graylog, which is not allowed.
panels.title: Router can't remove default

panels.description: Represents the number of search requests sent from Graylog to Elasticsearch.
panels.title: Searches, Ranges, Requests

panels.description: Counts the total number of messages with invalid timestamps encountered by the Graylog indexer.
panels.title: Invalid timestamps

panels.description: Measures the time taken by the Graylog indexer field type poller to complete its execution.
panels.title: Field type poller time

panels.description: Counts the number of system event posts scheduled by the Graylog event bus job scheduler.
panels.title: Scheduler system posts

panels.description: Tracks the number of system event registrations in the Graylog event bus job scheduler.
panels.title: Scheduler system registrations

panels.description: Measures the idle time of the executor service in the Graylog event bus provider.
panels.title: Scheduler system registrations

panels.description: Measures the processing time of blocking Elasticsearch output operations in Graylog.
panels.title: Output processing time

panels.description: Tracks the rate of buffer flushes in the blocking Elasticsearch output over a specified window.
panels.title: Output flushes

panels.description: Represents the batch size of messages processed by the blocking Elasticsearch output.
panels.title: Output batch size

panels.description: Represents the rate of failed Elasticsearch output operations over the last specified minutes.
panels.title: Writes and Failuers

panels.description: Represents the total number of failures consumed from the failure queue for the specified cluster, instance, and node.
panels.title: Failure consumed and submitted

panels.description: Represents the current size of the failure queue, indicating the number of failed messages waiting to be processed for the specified cluster, instance, and node.
panels.title: Failure queue size
